questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You plan to use Teams.

You run the Microsoft 365 network connectivity test tool and generate a report.

You discover that the Microsoft Teams section of the report has a warning notification for media connectivity.

You suspect a firewall issue at the test location.

Which destination protocol and port range should you configure on the firewall?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
100% UDP ports 3478 through 3481

comments.content: Oops, I meant to select answer D.

discussion.content: UDP ports 3478 through 3481

Selected Answer: D
UDP is used, instead of TCP
UDP ports 3478 through 3481, UDP for outbound:3478, 3479, 3480, 3481, TCP:443, 80. We are not open ports coming in, just out to access clouds from the local.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Teams with Operator Connect.

You plan to deploy Teams conference phones that support PSTN calls and one-touch join for Teams calendar meetings.

Which license should you assign to each conference phone?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
teams room pro is the correct answer
Teams Rooms Pro license: If you are using the audio-conferencing device in a small meeting room, you will need a Teams Rooms Pro license that will allow you to join audio meetings with one touch.

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Teams with Operator Connect.

Why will the correct answer be the same as the question?

Selected Answer: E
I think the answer is "E"
https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-blog/how-to-deploy-teams-phone-devices/ba-p/3994979

choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, enable Customer Lockbox.
choices.A: Assign the users a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
choices.B: Assign the users a Microsoft 365 F3 license.
choices.D: From the Audit settings of the Microsoft Purview compliance portal, select Start recording user and admin activity.

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

All users are assigned a Microsoft 365 F1 license.

You need to retain chats and files in Teams channels for at least one year after they are deleted.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A and b should not be needed so D https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/servicedescriptions/microsoft-365-service-descriptions/microsoft-365-tenantlevel-services-licensing-guidance/microsoft-365-security-compliance-licensing-guidance#licensing-for-retention-label-policies

Selected Answer: D
If the retention policy location is Microsoft Teams chats, channels, or private channels, then the following licenses also provide user rights. The retention or deletion period must be more than 30 days for the plans that are underlined:

Microsoft 365 E5/G5/A5/E3/G3/A3/F3/F1, Business Basic, Business Standard, and Business Premium

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/servicedescriptions/microsoft-365-service-descriptions/microsoft-365-tenantlevel-services-licensing-guidance/microsoft-365-security-compliance-licensing-guidance#microsoft-purview-data-lifecycle-management--microsoft-purview-records-management

comments.content: Since "files" are also included in the retention target, isn't there a lack of permissions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/retention-policies#:~:text=Users%20who%20are%20subject%20to%20a%20retention%20policy%20for%20Teams%20must%20have%20an%20appropriate%20license%2C%20such%20as%20Office%20365%20E3%20or%20Office%20365%20A3.
New question.

Selected Answer: A
Correct is A, tested it in my tenant.

B is wrong. The Teams Communication Support Specialist can't view Usage Reports in the Analytics & reports section, he can only view the Call quality dashboard there.

C is wrong. The Teams Devices Administrator has no Analytics & reports section in the Teams Administrator Center.

D is wrong. The Helpdesk Administrator has no privileges to open the Teams Admin Center.

Selected Answer: A
Access Teams reports
To access the Teams usage reports, you need to have one of the following roles assigned:
Global admin in Microsoft 365 or Office 365
Global reader in Microsoft 365 or Office 365
Teams admin
Skype for Business admin

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/monitor-your-microsoft-teams-environment/2-monitor-usage-reports

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription that contains a user named User1.

You need to ensure that User1 can view Usage reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.

Which role should you assign to User1?

HOTSPOT -
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You need to review the following information:
✑ The Rate My Call (RMC) data provided by users.
✑ The number of Microsoft Teams live event views from the past three months.
What should you use to view the information? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct

Both are under Analytics & reports:
1. Analytics & reports>CQD
2, Analytics & reports>Usage Reports
Was on exam 19.08.2022
Correct. Part of the exam on 9 August 2022
Correct, in exam on 25th of July 2022

Answer is correct
1. Analytics & reports -> CQD
2, Analytics & reports -> Usage Reports
Reference - 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-live-event-usage-report
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/turning-on-and-using-call-quality-dashboard

1. CQD
2. Analytics & reports

comments.content: In the Call Quality Dashboard you can use the dropdown to select "Rate my Call Reports", which displays the info called for in the question. 1 is CQD

discussion.content: I think for 1 should be Call History. This is by user.
